pull_request.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

pullrequest.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

content.raw: I think we need to update the ign-sensors-release repo. Apparently for every new component we add, we’ll need to add a new install file \(see this [ign-sensors-release folder](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors-release/src/default/ubuntu/debian)\). So in this case, I'll go ahead and try adding `libignition-sensors-rendering-dev.install` and `libignition-sensors-rendering.install` and see if that helps
content.html: I think we need to update the ign-sensors-release repo. Apparently for every new component we add, we’ll need to add a new install file (see this ign-sensors-release folder). So in this case, I'll go ahead and try adding libignition-sensors-rendering-dev.install and libignition-sensors-rendering.install and see if that helps

pull_request.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

pullrequest.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

content.raw:
I think you need to pass the names of components to `ign_configure_build` in the root CMakeLists.txt:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/796a58769476c0adb8e1bbf755826e107bfa0a2e/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-137:138

and the relevant include and src files should be in a `rendering` subfolder?
content.html:
I think you need to pass the names of components to ign_configure_build in the root CMakeLists.txt:

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/796a58769476c0adb8e1bbf755826e107bfa0a2e/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-137:138

and the relevant include and src files should be in a rendering subfolder?

pull_request.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

update.description:
The goal here is to separate out the classes and functions that require ign-rendering into it’s own component in ign-sensors so that the core of the sensor library is independent of ign-rendering.

The main challenge is that we cannot just remove existing functions and we need to go through a tick-tock cycle. So the ign-rendering dependent functions are being deprecated in ign-sensors2 and the ign-rendering dependency removal can only be complete in ign-sensors3.

Main changes are:

* added new `rendering` component that contains a base RenderingSensor class
* DepthCamera, GpuLidar classes are now derived from RenderingSensor
* rendering/scene related functions in `Manager` and `Sensor` classes are being deprecated
update.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

pull_request.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

pullrequest.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

content.raw: Sure we can keep the manager inside ign-sensors for now in case we find it useful in the future. The intention of deprecating this API is to remove the dependency of the Manager class on ign-rendering. So for example, when someone wants to use the manager class to manage an IMU sensor then the person can use ign-sensors without the need to install ign-rendering at all.
content.html: Sure we can keep the manager inside ign-sensors for now in case we find it useful in the future. The intention of deprecating this API is to remove the dependency of the Manager class on ign-rendering. So for example, when someone wants to use the manager class to manage an IMU sensor then the person can use ign-sensors without the need to install ign-rendering at all.

content.raw: I reported a bug for Homebrew unrelated to this PR. Besides that I tested it and LGTM. I have some comments about deprecation plans for the manager in ign-sensors but it is not blocking.
content.html: I reported a bug for Homebrew unrelated to this PR. Besides that I tested it and LGTM. I have some comments about deprecation plans for the manager in ign-sensors but it is not blocking.

pull_request.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

pullrequest.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

content.raw: Does this deprecated means that we will remove the manager from sensors completely? It was useful to have it around for testing purposes \(or as example if someone want to re use this code\). Although I am completely on board with moving it into ign-gazebo,  we should maybe move the manager into test later? What do you think? It is also true that can be problematic to maintain, but as long as we keep testing sensors separately we will be forced to keep it up to date.
content.html: Does this deprecated means that we will remove the manager from sensors completely? It was useful to have it around for testing purposes (or as example if someone want to re use this code). Although I am completely on board with moving it into ign-gazebo, we should maybe move the manager into test later? What do you think? It is also true that can be problematic to maintain, but as long as we keep testing sensors separately we will be forced to keep it up to date.
